ruleTitle: Schema marked as reference schema document must conform
ruleText: Any schema document with an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/3.0/#ReferenceSchemaDocument MUST be a reference schema document.

ruleTitle: Schema marked as extension schema document must conform
ruleText: Any schema document with an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/3.0/#ExtensionSchemaDocument MUST be an extension schema document.

ruleTitle: Schema is CTAS-conformant
ruleText: The document MUST be a conformant document as defined by the NIEM Conformance Targets Attribute Specification.

ruleTitle: Document element has attribute ct:conformanceTargets
ruleText: The [document element] of the XML document, and only the [document element], MUST own an attribute {http://release.niem.gov/niem/conformanceTargets/3.0/}conformanceTargets.

ruleTitle: Schema claims reference schema conformance target
ruleText: The document MUST have an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/3.0/#ReferenceSchemaDocument.

ruleTitle: Schema claims extension conformance target
ruleText: The document MUST have an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/3.0/#ExtensionSchemaDocument.

ruleTitle: Document is an XML document
ruleText: The document MUST be an XML document.

ruleTitle: Document uses XML namespaces properly
ruleText: The document MUST be namespace-well-formed and namespace-valid.

ruleTitle: Document is a schema document
ruleText: The document MUST be a schema document.

ruleTitle: Document element is xs:schema
ruleText: The [document element] of the XML document MUST have the name xs:schema.

ruleTitle: Component name follows ISO 11179 Part 5 Annex A
ruleText: A NIEM component name MUST be formed by applying the informative guidelines and examples detailed in Annex A of [ISO 11179-5], with exceptions as specified in this document.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type in the XML namespace
ruleText: A schema component must not have a base type definition with a {target namespace} that is the XML namespace.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:ID.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:IDREF.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:IDREFS
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:IDREFS.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:anyType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:anyType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:anySimpleType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:NOTATION
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:NOTATION.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:ENTITY.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:ENTITIES
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:ENTITIES.

ruleTitle: Simple type definition is top-level
ruleText: A simple type definition MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: No simple type disallowed derivation
ruleText: An element xs:simpleType MUST NOT have an attribute {}final.

ruleTitle: Simple type has data definition
ruleText: A simple type MUST have a data definition.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:ID.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:IDREF.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:anySimpleType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:ENTITY.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:ID.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:IDREF.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:IDREFS
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:IDREFS.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:anySimpleType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:ENTITY.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:ENTITIES
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:ENTITIES.

ruleTitle: Enumeration has data definition
ruleText: An enumeration facet MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Complex type definitions is top-level
ruleText: A complex type definition MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: Complex type has data definition
ruleText: A complex type MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: No mixed content on complex type
ruleText: A complex type definition MUST NOT have mixed content.

ruleTitle: No mixed content on complex content
ruleText: A complex type definition with complex content MUST NOT have mixed content.

ruleTitle: Complex type content is explicitly simple or complex
ruleText: An element xs:complexType MUST have a child element xs:simpleContent or xs:complexContent.

ruleTitle: Complex content uses extension
ruleText: An element xs:complexContent MUST have a child xs:extension.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.3.2.1. Base type of complex type with complex content has complex content
ruleTitle: Base type of complex type with complex content must have complex content
ruleText: The base type of complex type that has complex content MUST be a complex type with complex content.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.3.2.1. Base type of complex type with complex content has complex content
ruleTitle: Base type of complex type with complex content must have complex content
ruleText: The base type of complex type that has complex content MUST have complex content.

ruleTitle: Simple content uses extension
ruleText: A complex type definition with simple content schema component MUST have a derivation method of extension.

ruleTitle: No complex type disallowed substitutions
ruleText: An element xs:complexType MUST NOT have an attribute {}block.

ruleTitle: No complex type disallowed derivation
ruleText: An element xs:complexType MUST NOT have an attribute {}final.

ruleTitle: Element declaration is top-level
ruleText: An element declaration MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: Element declaration has data definition
ruleText: An element declaration MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Untyped element is abstract
ruleText: A top-level element declaration that does not set the {type definition} property via the attribute "type" MUST have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

ruleTitle: Element of type xs:anySimpleType is abstract
ruleText: An element declaration that has a type xs:anySimpleType MUST have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

ruleTitle: Element type not in the XML Schema namespace
ruleText: An element type that is not xs:anySimpleType MUST NOT have a namespace name xs.

ruleTitle: Element type not in the XML namespace
ruleText: An element type MUST NOT have a namespace name that is in the XML namespace.

ruleTitle: Element type is not simple type
ruleText: An element type that is not xs:anySimpleType MUST NOT be a simple type.

ruleTitle: No element disallowed substitutions
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}block.

ruleTitle: No element disallowed derivation
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}final.

ruleTitle: No element default value
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}default.

ruleTitle: No element fixed value
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}fixed.

ruleTitle: Element declaration is nillable
ruleText: An element declaration MUST have the {nillable} property with a value of true.

ruleTitle: Attribute declaration is top-level
ruleText: An attribute declaration MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: Attribute declaration has data definition
ruleText: An attribute declaration MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Attribute declaration has type
ruleText: A top-level attribute declaration MUST have a type.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:ID.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:IDREF.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:IDREFS
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:IDREFS.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:ENTITY.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:ENTITIES
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:ENTITIES.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:anySimpleType.

ruleTitle: No attribute default values
ruleText: An element xs:attribute MUST NOT have an attribute {}default.

ruleTitle: No attribute fixed values
ruleText: An element xs:attribute MUST NOT have an attribute {}fixed.

ruleTitle: No use of element xs:notation
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:notation.

ruleTitle: Model group does not affect meaning
ruleText: The use of model groups xs:all, xs:sequence, and xs:choice MUST NOT define the semantics of an instance. The meaning of an element occurrance within an element occurrence MUST be identical, regardless of the model group used to define a schema component.

ruleTitle: No xs:all
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:all

ruleTitle: xs:sequence must be child of xs:extension
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST be a child of element xs:extension.

ruleTitle: xs:sequence must be child of xs:extension or xs:restriction
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST be a child of element xs:extension or xs:restriction.

ruleTitle: No xs:choice
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:choice

ruleTitle: xs:choice must be child of xs:sequence
ruleText: An element xs:choice MUST be a child of element xs:sequence.

ruleTitle: Sequence has minimum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST either not have the attribute {}minOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: Sequence has maximum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST either not have the attribute {}maxOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: Choice has minimum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:choice MUST either not have the attribute {}minOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: Choice has maximum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:choice MUST either not have the attribute {}maxOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:any
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:any.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:anyAttribute
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:anyAttribute.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:unique
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:unique.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:key
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:key.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:keyref
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:keyref.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:group
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:group.

ruleTitle: No definition of attribute groups
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain an attribute group definition schema component.

ruleTitle: Comment is not recommended
ruleText: An XML Comment is not an XML Schema annotation component; an XML comment SHOULD NOT appear in the schema.

ruleTitle: Documentation element has no element children
ruleText: A child of element xs:documentation MUST be text or an XML comment.

ruleTitle: xs:appinfo children are comments, elements, or whitespace
ruleText: A child of element xs:appinfo MUST be an element, a comment, or whitespace text.

ruleTitle: Appinfo child elements have namespaces
ruleText: An element that is a child of xs:appinfo MUST have a namespace name.

ruleTitle: Appinfo descendants are not XML Schema elements
ruleText: An element with a namespace name of xs: MUST NOT have an ancestor element xs:appinfo.

ruleTitle: Schema has data definition
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Schema document defines target namespace
ruleText: The schema MUST define a target namespace.

ruleTitle: Target namespace is absolute URI
ruleText: The value of the attribute targetNamespace MUST match the production <absolute-URI> as defined by RFC 3986.

ruleTitle: Schema has version
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST have an attribute {}version that MUST NOT be empty.

ruleTitle: No disallowed substitutions
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST NOT have an attribute {}blockDefault.

ruleTitle: No disallowed derivations
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST NOT have an attribute {}finalDefault.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:redefine
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:redefine.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:include
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:include.

ruleTitle: xs:import must have namespace
ruleText: An element xs:import MUST have an attribute {}namespace.

ruleTitle: XML Schema document set must be complete
ruleText: The schema document set must constitute a complete XML Schema; it must contain the definition of every schema component referenced by any component defined by the schema set.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute type is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @type MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute base is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @base MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute itemType is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @itemType MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespaces referenced by attribute memberTypes is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @memberTypes MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute ref is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a component referenced by @ref MUST be the target namespace or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute substitutionGroup is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a component referenced by @substitutionGroup MUST be the target namespace or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 10.1. Categories of NIEM type definitions
ruleTitle: Complex type has a category
ruleText:
Within the schema, a complex type definition MUST be one of the following: 
- An object type. 
- An association type. 
- A metadata type. 
- An augmentation type.

sectionLabel: Section 10.2.1.1. Object types with complex content
ruleTitle: Object type with complex content is derived from object type
ruleText: An object type with complex content MUST be derived from structures:ObjectType or from another object type.

ruleTitle: RoleOf element type is an object type
ruleText: The type definition of a RoleOf element MUST be an object type.

ruleTitle: Only object type has RoleOf element
ruleText: A complex type that includes a RoleOf element in its content model MUST be an object type.

ruleTitle: RoleOf elements indicate the base types of a role type
ruleText: An element declaration that has a local name that begins with the string RoleOf MUST represent a base type, of which the containing element instance represents a role.

ruleTitle: Instance of RoleOf element indicates a role object
ruleText:
When a parent element has a child element valid to an element declaration that is a RoleOf element, 
- The value of the parent element is a role object. 
- The value of the child element is a base object of the role object.

ruleTitle: Import of external namespace has data definition
ruleText: An element xs:import that is annotated as importing an external schema document MUST be a documented component.

ruleTitle: External adapter type has indicator
ruleText: A type is an external adapter type if and only if it is a complex type with application information of attribute appinfo:externalAdapterTypeIndicator with a value of true.

ruleTitle: Structure of external adapter type definition follows pattern
ruleText: An external adapter type definition MUST be a complex type definition with complex content that extends structures:ObjectType, and that uses xs:sequence as its top-level compositor.

ruleTitle: Element use from external adapter type defined by external schema documents
ruleText: An element reference that appears within an external adapter type MUST have a target namespace that is imported as external.

ruleTitle: External adapter type not a base type
ruleText: An external adapter type definition MUST NOT be a base type definition.

ruleTitle: External adapter type not a base type
ruleText: An external adapter type definition MUST NOT be a base type definition.

ruleTitle: External attribute use only in external adapter type
ruleText: An external attribute use MUST be in an external adapter type.

ruleTitle: External attribute use has data definition
ruleText: An external attribute use MUST be a documented component with a non-empty data definition.

ruleTitle: External attribute use not an ID
ruleText: An attribute use schema component MUST NOT have an {attribute declaration} with an ID type.

ruleTitle: External element use has data definition
ruleText: An external attribute use MUST be a documented component with a non-empty data definition.

ruleTitle: Name of code type ends in CodeType
ruleText: A complex type definition MUST have a {name} that ends in 'CodeType' if and only if it has a {base type definition} of a code type or code simple type.

ruleTitle: Proxy type has designated structure
ruleText: A proxy type MUST have the designated structure. It MUST use xs:extension. It MUST NOT use xs:attribute. It MUST include exactly one xs:attributeGroup reference, which must be to structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup.

ruleTitle: Association types is derived from association type
ruleText: A type MUST have a association type name if and only if it is derived from an association type.

ruleTitle: Association element type is an association type
ruleText: An element MUST have a name that ends in 'Association' if and only if it has a type that is an association type.

ruleTitle: Augmentable type has augmentation point element
ruleText: An augmentable type MUST contain an element use of its augmentation point element.

ruleTitle: Augmentable type has at most one augmentation point element
ruleText: An augmentable type MUST contain no more than one element use of its augmentation point element.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point corresponds to augmentable type
ruleText: A schema document containing an augmentation point element declaration MUST also contain a corresponding augmentable type definition.

ruleTitle: An augmentation point has no type
ruleText: An augmentation point element MUST have no type.

ruleTitle: An augmentation point has no substitution group
ruleText: An augmentation point element MUST have no substitution group.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point element may only be referenced by its type
ruleText: An augmentation point element MUST only be referenced by its corresponding type.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point reference is optional
ruleText: An augmentation point element particle MUST have attribute minOccurs equal to 0.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point reference is unbounded
ruleText: An augmentation point element particle MUST have attribute maxOccurs set to unbounded.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point reference must be last particle
ruleText: An augmentation point element particle MUST be the last element occurrence in its content model.

ruleTitle: Element within instance of augmentation type modifies base
ruleText:
Given:Element $relationship establishes a relationship between $base-value and the value of $relationship. 
- Some element has a value $base-value. 
- Value $base-value contains element $augmentation. 
- Element $augmentation has property [element declaration] with a value that is an augmentation element declaration. 
- Element $augmentation has a value, by reference or by content. 
- The value of $augmentation contains element $relationship. 
- Element $relationship has a value, by reference or by content.

ruleTitle: Only an augmentation type name ends in AugmentationType
ruleText: A schema component that has a name that ends in AugmentationType MUST be an augmentation type.

ruleTitle: Schema component with name ending in AugmentationType is an augmentation type
ruleText: An augmentation type definition schema component with {name} ending in 'AugmentationType' MUST be an augmentation type definition that is a complex type definition with complex content that extends or restricts an augmentation type.

ruleTitle: Type derived from augmentation type is an augmentation type
ruleText: A type definition derived from an augmentation type MUST be an augmentation type definition

ruleTitle: Augmentation element type is an augmentation type
ruleText: An element declaration MUST have a name that ends in "Augmentation" if and only if it has a type that is an augmentation type.

ruleTitle: Augmentation elements are not used directly
ruleText:
Within a reference schema document, a complex type definition MUST NOT have an element use of 
- an augmentation element declaration, or 
- an element declration that is in the substitution group of an augmentation point element declaration.

ruleTitle: Metadata type has data about data
ruleText: Within the schema, a metadata type MUST contain elements appropriate for a specific class of data about data.

ruleTitle: Metadata type derived from structures:MetadataType
ruleText: Within the schema, a metadata type and only a metadata type MUST be derived directly from structures:MetadataType.

ruleTitle: Metadata types are derived from metadata types
ruleText: A type MUST have a metadata type name if an only if it is derived from a metadata type.

ruleTitle: Metadata element declaration type is a metadata type
ruleText: An element MUST have a name that ends in 'Metadata' if and only if it has a type that is a metadata type.

ruleTitle: Metadata element has applicable elements
ruleText:
The set of applicable elements for a metadata element declaration are as follows: 
- A metadata element declaration that has neither an attribute appinfo:appliesToTypes nor an attribute appinfo:appliesToElements may be applied to any element. 
- A metadata element declaration that has either an attribute appinfo:appliesToTypes or an attribute appinfo:appliesToElements may be applied to any element whose qualified name is in the value of appinfo:appliesToElements, or any element with a declaration that is in the substitution group of the declaration of such an element, and to any element with a type with a qualified name that is in the value of appinfo:appliesToTypes, or any element with a type that is validly derived from such a type. 
- any element whose qualified name is in the value of appinfo:appliesToElements, or any element with a declaration that is in the substitution group of the declaration of such an element, and to 
- any element with a type with a qualified name that is in the value of appinfo:appliesToTypes, or any element with a type that is validly derived from such a type.

ruleTitle: Name of element that ends in Representation is abstract
ruleText: An element declaration with a name that ends in 'Representation' SHOULD have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

sectionLabel: Section 10. Rules for NIEM modeling, by NIEM concept
ruleTitle: A substitution for a representation element declaration is a value for a type
ruleText: Any element declaration that is substitutable for a a representation element declaration represents an optional representation of a value of a type that carries the representation element.

ruleTitle: Schema component name composed of English words
ruleText: The name of any XML Schema component defined by the schema MUST be composed of words from the English language, using the prevalent U.S. spelling, as provided by [OED].

ruleTitle: Schema component names have only specific characters
ruleText:
The name of any XML Schema component defined by the schema MUST contain only the following characters:Other characters, such as the underscore (_) character and the period (.) character MUST NOT appear in component names in NIEM-conformant schemas. 
- Upper-case letters (A–Z). 
- Lower-case letters (a–z). 
- Digits (0–9). 
- Hyphen (-).

ruleTitle: Hyphen in component name is a separator
ruleText: The hyphen character (-) MAY appear in component names only when used as a separator between parts of a single word, phrase, or value, which would otherwise be incomprehensible without the use of a separator.

ruleTitle: Names use camel case
ruleText: The name of any XML Schema component defined by the schema MUST use the camel case formatting convention.

ruleTitle: Attribute name begins with lower case letter
ruleText: Within the schema, any attribute declaration MUST have a name that begins with a lower-case letter (a–z).

ruleTitle: Name of schema component other than attribute begins with upper case letter
ruleText: Within the schema, any XML Schema component other than an attribute declaration MUST have a name that begins with an upper-case letter (A–Z).

sectionLabel: Section 10.8.2. Use of acronyms and abbreviations
ruleTitle: Names use common abbreviations
ruleText: The schema MUST use, in defined names, the abbreviations identified by Table 10-1, Abbreviations used in schema component names, rather than their full meanings.

sectionLabel: Section 10.8.2.1. Use of Acronyms, Initialisms, Abbreviations, and Jargon
ruleTitle: Local term declaration is local to its schema document
ruleText: An element term:LocalTerm MUST establish the meaning of a local term only within the XML Schema document in which it occurs. There MUST NOT be any transitive inheritance of local terminology within schema documents that import the containing schema document.

sectionLabel: Section 10.8.2.1. Use of Acronyms, Initialisms, Abbreviations, and Jargon
ruleTitle: Local terminology interpretation
ruleText:
An element information item term:LocalTerm MUST establish a term as follows: 
- The value of the attribute term is the local term; it may occur as a term within the name of a schema component within the schema document. 
- The value of the attribute literal is the meaning of the local term, provided as a full, plain-text form of the term. This may be useful when a local term is an abbreviation, acronym, or diminutive form of a longer term. 
- The value of the attribute definition is a dictionary-style description of the meaning of the local term. 
- The value of the attribute sourceURIs is a list of URIs, each of which is an identifier or locator for an originating or authoritative document defining the term. 
- Each child element information item term:SourceText is a plain text citation of, reference to, or bibliographic entry for an originating or authoritative document defining the term.

ruleTitle: Singular form is preferred in name
ruleText: A noun used as a term in the name of an XML Schema component MUST be in singular form unless the concept itself is plural.

ruleTitle: Present tense is preferred in name
ruleText: A verb used as a term in the name of an XML Schema component MUST be used in the present tense unless the concept itself is past tense.

ruleTitle: Name does not have nonessential words
ruleText: Articles, conjunctions, and prepositions MUST NOT be used in NIEM component names except where they are required for clarity or by standard convention.

ruleTitle: Component name follows pattern
ruleText:
Except as specified elsewhere in this document, any element or attribute defined within the schema MUST have a name that takes the form: 
- Object-class qualifier terms (0 or more). 
- An object class term (1). 
- Property qualifier terms (0 or more). 
- A property term (1). 
- Representation qualifier terms (0 or more). 
- A representation term (0 or 1).

ruleTitle: Object-class term identifies concrete category
ruleText: The object-class term of a NIEM component MUST consist of a term identifying a category of concrete concepts or entities.

ruleTitle: Property term describes characteristic or subpart
ruleText: A property term MUST describe or represent a characteristic or subpart of an entity or concept.

ruleTitle: Name may have multiple qualifier terms
ruleText: Multiple qualifier terms MAY be used within a component name as necessary to ensure clarity and uniqueness within its namespace and usage context.

ruleTitle: Name has minimum necessary number of qualifier terms
ruleText: The number of qualifier terms SHOULD be limited to the absolute minimum required to make the component name unique and understandable.

ruleTitle: Order of qualifies is not significant
ruleText: The order of qualifiers MUST NOT be used to differentiate names.

ruleTitle: Redundant term in name is omitted
ruleText: If any word in the representation term is redundant with any word in the property term, one occurrence SHOULD be deleted.

ruleTitle: Element with simple content has representation term
ruleText: Within the schema, the name of an element declaration that is of simple content MUST use an appropriate representation term as found in Table 10-2, Representation terms.

ruleTitle: Name has representation term when appropriate
ruleText: Within the schema, the name of an element declaration that is of complex content, and that corresponds to a concept listed in Table 10-2, Representation terms, MUST use a representation term from that table.

ruleTitle: Name has representation term only when appropriate
ruleText: Within the schema, the name of an element declaration that is of complex content and that does not correspond to a concept listed in Table 10-2, Representation terms MUST NOT use a representation term.

ruleTitle: Machine-readable annotations are valid
ruleText: Every element information item or attribute information item that appears as a machine-readable annotation in a schema MUST be a valid instance, according to its specification.

ruleTitle: Component marked as deprecated is deprecated component
ruleText: A schema component that has an attribute appinfo:deprecated with a value of true MUST be a deprecated component.

ruleTitle: Deprecated annotates schema component
ruleText: The attribute appinfo:deprecated MUST be owned by an element with a namespace name xs.

ruleTitle: External import indicator annotates import
ruleText: The attribute {http://release.niem.gov/niem/appinfo/3.0/}externalImportIndicator MUST be owned by an element xs:import.

ruleTitle: External adapter type indicator annotates complex type
ruleText: The attribute appinfo:externalAdapterTypeIndicator MUST be owned by an element xs:complexType.

ruleTitle: appinfo:appliesToTypes annotates metadata element
ruleText: The attribute appinfo:appliesToTypes MUST be owned by a metadata element.

ruleTitle: appinfo:appliesToTypes references types
ruleText: Every item in @appinfo:appliesToTypes MUST resolve to a type.

ruleTitle: appinfo:appliesToElements annotates metadata element
ruleText: The attribute appinfo:appliesToElements MUST be owned by a metadata element.

ruleTitle: appinfo:appliesToElements references elements
ruleText: Every item in @appinfo:appliesToElements MUST resolve to an element.

sectionLabel: Section 10.9.2. The NIEM local terminology namespace
ruleTitle: term:LocalTerm annotates schema
ruleText: The element term:LocalTerm MUST be application information an an element xs:schema.

sectionLabel: Section 10.9.2. The NIEM local terminology namespace
ruleTitle: term:LocalTerm has literal or definition
ruleText: The element {http://release.niem.gov/niem/localTerminology/3.0/}LocalTerm MUST have a literal or definition.

ruleTitle: Use structures as specified
ruleText: The schema or instance MUST use content within the NIEM structures namespace as specified in this document and ONLY as specified by this document.

ruleTitle: Name of type ends in Type
ruleText: The name of a proxy type does not end in "Type".   A type definition schema component that does not define a proxy type MUST have a name that ends in "Type".

ruleTitle: Name of type other than proxy type is in upper camel case
ruleText: The name of a proxy type is not upper camel case.   A type definition schema component that does not define a proxy type MUST be in upper camel case.

ruleTitle: Base type definition defined by conformant schema
ruleText: The {base type definition} of a type definition MUST have the target namespace or the XML Schema namespace or a namespace that is imported as conformant.

ruleTitle: Name of simple type ends in SimpleType
ruleText: A simple type definition schema component MUST have a name that ends in "SimpleType".

ruleTitle: Name of simple type is upper camel case
ruleText: The name of a simple type definition schema component MUST be upper camel case.

ruleTitle: Use lists only when data is uniform
ruleText: Within the schema, a simple type definition that uses xs:list SHOULD NOT be defined if any member of the list requires a property or metadata that is different than other members of the list. All members of the list SHOULD have the same metadata, and should be related via the same properties.

ruleTitle: List item type defined by conformant schemas
ruleText: The item type of a list simple type definition MUST have a target namespace equal to the target namespace of the XML Schema document within which it is defined, or a namespace that is imported as conformant by the schema document within which it is defined.

ruleTitle: Union member types defined by conformant schemas
ruleText: Every member type of a union simple type definition MUST have a target namespace that is equal to either the target namespace of the XML Schema document within which it is defined or a namespace that is imported as conformant by the schema document within which it is defined.

ruleTitle: Name of a code simple type has standard suffix
ruleText: A simple type definition schema component that has an enumeration facet or that is derived from a code type MUST have a name that ends in "CodeSimpleType".

ruleTitle: Code simple type has enumerations
ruleText: A code simple type MUST be derived from a code simple type or have an enumeration facet.

ruleTitle: Complex type with simple content has structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup
ruleText: A complex type definition with simple content schema component with a derivation method of extension that has a base type definition that is a simple type MUST incorporate the attribute group {http://release.niem.gov/niem/structures/3.0/}SimpleObjectAttributeGroup.     A data type for a kind of passport.

ruleTitle: Element name is upper camel case
ruleText: The name of an element declaration MUST be upper camel case.

ruleTitle: Element type does not have a simple type name
ruleText: The {type definition} of an element declaration MUST NOT have a {name} that ends in 'SimpleType'.

ruleTitle: Element type is from conformant namespace
ruleText: The {type definition} of an element declaration MUST have a {target namespace} that is the target namespace, or one that is imported as conformant.

ruleTitle: Name of element that ends in Abstract is abstract
ruleText: An element declaration with a name that ends in 'Abstract' MUST have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

ruleTitle: Name of element declaration with simple content has representation term
ruleText: The name of an element declaration that is of simple content MUST use a representation term.

ruleTitle: Name of element declaration with simple content has representation term
ruleText: the name of an element declaration that is of simple content MUST use a representation term.

ruleTitle: Element substitution group defined by conformant schema
ruleText: An element substitution group MUST have either the target namespace or a namespace that is imported as conformant.

ruleTitle: Attribute type defined by conformant schema
ruleText: The type of an attribute declaration MUST have the target namespace or the XML Schema namespace or a namespace that is imported as conformant.

ruleTitle: Attribute name uses representation term
ruleText: An attribute name MUST end with a representation term.

ruleTitle: Element or attribute declaration introduced only once into a type
ruleText: Within the schema, an element declaration or attribute decaration MUST NOT be introduced more than once into a type definition. This applies to content acquired by a type by any means, including from a base type definition, via element substitution groups, or through the use of attribute groups.

ruleTitle: Element reference defined by conformant schema
ruleText: An element reference MUST be to a component that has a namespace that is either the target namespace of the schema document in which it appears, or which is imported as conformant by that schema document.

ruleTitle: Referenced attribute defined by conformant schemas
ruleText: An attribute {}ref MUST have the target namespace or a namespace that is imported as conformant.

ruleTitle: Schema uses only known attribute groups
ruleText: An attribute group reference MUST be structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup or have the IC-ISM or IC-NTK namespace.

ruleTitle: Data definition does not introduce ambiguity
ruleText: Words or synonyms for the words within a data definition MUST NOT be reused as terms in the corresponding component name if those words dilute the semantics and understanding of, or impart ambiguity to, the entity or concept that the component represents.

ruleTitle: Object class has only one meaning
ruleText: An object class MUST have one and only one associated semantic meaning (i.e., a single word sense) as described in the definition of the component that represents that object class.

ruleTitle: Data definition of a part does not redefine the whole
ruleText: An object class MUST NOT be redefined within the definitions of the components that represent properties or subparts of that entity or class.

ruleTitle: Do not leak representation into data definition
ruleText: A data definition MUST NOT contain explicit representational or data typing information such as number of characters, classes of characters, range of mathematical values, etc., unless the very nature of the component can be described only by such information.

ruleTitle: Data definition follows 11179-4 requirements
ruleText: Each data definition MUST conform to the requirements for data definitions provided by [ISO 11179-4] Section 5.2, Requirements.

ruleTitle: Data definition follows 11179-4 recommendations
ruleText: Each data definition SHOULD conform to the recommendations for data definitions provided by [ISO 11179-4] Section 5.3, Recommendations.

ruleTitle: Standard opening phrase for element
ruleText: The data definition for an augmentation point element SHOULD begin with standard opening phrase "an augmentation point...".   The data definition for an augmentation element SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "supplements..." or "additional information about...".   The data definition for a metadata element SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "metadata about..." or "information that further qualifies...".   The data defintion for an association element that is not abstract SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "an (optional adjectives) (relationship|association)...".   The data defintion for an abstract element SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "a data concept...".   The data defintion for an element with a date representation term SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "a(n?) (optional adjectives) (date|month|year)...".   The data defintion for an element with a quantity representation term SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "an (optional adjectives) (count|number)...".   The data defintion for an element with a picture representation term SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "an (optional adjectives) (image|picture|photograph)".   The data defintion for an element with an indicator representation term SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "true if ...; false (otherwise|if)...".   The data defintion for an element with an identification representation term SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "(a|an) (optional adjectives) identification...".   The data defintion for an element with a name representation term SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "(a|an) (optional adjectives) name...".   The data defintion for an element declaration with a name SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "(a|an)".

ruleTitle: Standard opening phrase for complex type
ruleText: The data definition for an association type SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "a datatype for (a relationship|an association)...".   The data definition for an augmentation type SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "a data type (that supplements|for additional information about)...".   The data definition for a metadata type SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "a data type for (metdata about|information that further qualifies)...".   The data definition for a type SHOULD begin with the standard opening phrase "a data type...".

ruleTitle: Standard opening phrase for simple type
ruleText: The data definition for a type SHOULD begin with a standard opening phrase "a data type...".

ruleTitle: Same namespace means same components
ruleText: Two XML Schema documents MUST have the same value for attribute targetNamespace carried by the element xs:schema, if and only if they represent the same set of components.

ruleTitle: Different version means different view
ruleText: Two XML Schema documents MUST have the same value for attribute targetNamespace carried by the element xs:schema, and different values for attribute version carried by the element xs:schema if and only if they are different views of the same set of components.

ruleTitle: Reference schema imports reference schema
ruleText: A namespace imported as conformant from a reference schema document MUST identify a namespace defined by a reference schema document.

ruleTitle: Extension schema document imports reference or extension schema
ruleText: A namespace imported as conformant from an extension schema document MUST identify a namespace defined by a reference schema document or an extension schema document.

sectionLabel: Section 11.8.1. Supporting namespaces are imported as conformant
ruleTitle: Structures imported as conformant
ruleText: An import of the structures namespace MUST NOT be labeled as an external import.

sectionLabel: Section 11.8.1. Supporting namespaces are imported as conformant
ruleTitle: XML namespace imported as conformant
ruleText: An import of the XML namespace MUST NOT be labeld as an external import.

ruleTitle: Each namespace may have only a single root schema in a schema set
ruleText: A namespace may appear as a root schema in a schema set only once.

ruleTitle: Consistently marked namespace imports
ruleText: All xs:import elements that have the same namespace MUST have the same conformance marking via appinfo:externalImportIndicator.

ruleTitle: Instance must be schema-valid
ruleText: The XML document MUST be schema-valid, as assessed against a conformant schema document set, composed of authoritative, comprehensive schema documents for the relevant namespaces.

ruleTitle: Element with structures:ref does not have content
ruleText: An element that has attribute structures:ref MUST NOT have element or text content.

ruleTitle: Attribute structures:ref must reference structures:id
ruleText: The value of an attribute structures:ref MUST match the value of an attribute structures:id of some element in the XML document.

ruleTitle: Linked elements have same validation root
ruleText:
Given that:Every element that has an attribute structures:ref MUST have a referencing element validation root that is equal to the referenced element validation root. 
- $element is an element information item 
- $element has attribute structures:ref with value $ref 
- $element has property [validation context] with value called the referencing element validation root 
- $target is an element information item 
- $target has attribute structures:id with value $ref 
- $target has property [validation context] with value called the referenced element validation root

ruleTitle: Attribute structures:ref references element of correct type
ruleText:
Given that:Every element that has an attribute structures:ref MUST have a referencing element type definition that is validly derived from the referenced element type definition. 
- $element is an element information item 
- $element has attribute structures:ref with value $ref 
- $element has property [element declaration] with value $element-declaration 
- $element-declaration has property {type definition} with value called the referencing element type definition 
- $target is an element information item 
- $target has attribute structures:id with value $ref 
- $target has property [type definition] with value called the referenced element type definition

sectionLabel: Section 12.2.1. Reference and content elements have same meaning
ruleTitle: Reference and content elements have the same meaning
ruleText: There MUST NOT be any difference in meaning between a relationship established via an element declaration instantiated as a content element and that element declaration instantiated as a reference element.

ruleTitle: Empty content has no meaning
ruleText: Within the instance, the meaning of an element with no content is that additional properties are not asserted. There MUST NOT be additional meaning interpreted for an element with no content.

ruleTitle: Metadata applies to referring entity
ruleText: Within an element instance, when an object $O links to a metadata object via an attribute structures:metadata, the information in the metadata object MUST be applied to the object $O.

ruleTitle: Referent of structures:relationshipMetadata annotates relationship
ruleText: Within an element instance, when an object $O1 contains an element $E, with content object $O2 or with a reference to object $O2, and $O2 links to a metadata object via an attribute structures:relationshipMetadata, the information in the metadata object MUST be applied to the relationship $E between $O1 and $O2.

ruleTitle: Values of structures:metadata refer to values of structures:id
ruleText: Given that each IDREF in the value of an attribute structures:metadata must match the value of an ID attribute on some element in the XML document, that ID attribute MUST be an occurrence of the attribute structures:id.

ruleTitle: Value of structures:relationshipMetadata refers to value of structures:id
ruleText: Given that each IDREF in the value of an attribute structures:relationshipMetadata must match the value of an ID attribute on some element in the XML document, that ID attribute MUST be an occurrence of the attribute structures:id.

ruleTitle: structures:metadata and structures:relationshipMetadata refer to metadata elements
ruleText: Each element referenced by an attribute structures:metadata or an attribute structures:relationshipMetadata MUST have [element declaration] that is a metadata element declaration.

ruleTitle: Attribute structures:metadata references metadata element
ruleText: Each item in the value of an attribute structures:metadata MUST appear as the value of an attribute structures:id with an owner element that is a metadata element.

ruleTitle: Attribute structures:relationshipMetadata references metadata element
ruleText: Each item in the value of an attribute structures:relationshipMetadata MUST appear as the value of an attribute structures:id with an owner element that is a metadata element.

ruleTitle: Metadata is applicable to element
ruleText: Given that an element $SUBJECT-ELEMENT uses a metadata element $METADATA-ELEMENT through a value in either an attribute structures:metadata or an attribute structures:relationshipMetadata, the element $SUBJECT-ELEMENT MUST be an applicable element for $METADATA-ELEMENT.

ruleTitle: Schema marked as reference schema document must conform
ruleText: Any schema document with an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/4.0/#ReferenceSchemaDocument MUST be a reference schema document.

ruleTitle: Schema marked as extension schema document must conform
ruleText: Any schema document with an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/4.0/#ExtensionSchemaDocument MUST be an extension schema document.

ruleTitle: Schema is CTAS-conformant
ruleText: The schema document MUST be a conformant document as defined by the NIEM Conformance Targets Attribute Specification.

ruleTitle: Document element has attribute ct:conformanceTargets
ruleText: The [document element] of the XML document, and only the [document element], MUST own an attribute {http://release.niem.gov/niem/conformanceTargets/3.0/}conformanceTargets.

ruleTitle: Schema claims reference schema conformance target
ruleText: The document MUST have an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/4.0/#ReferenceSchemaDocument.

ruleTitle: Schema claims extension conformance target
ruleText: The document MUST have an effective conformance target identifier of http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/4.0/#ExtensionSchemaDocument.

ruleTitle: Document is an XML document
ruleText: The document MUST be an XML document.

ruleTitle: Document uses XML namespaces properly
ruleText: The document MUST be namespace-well-formed and namespace-valid.

ruleTitle: Document is a schema document
ruleText: The [XML document] MUST be a [schema document].

ruleTitle: Document element is xs:schema
ruleText: The [document element] of the [XML document] MUST have the name xs:schema.

ruleTitle: Component name follows ISO 11179 Part 5 Annex A
ruleText: A NIEM component name SHOULD be formed by applying the informative guidelines and examples detailed in Annex A of [ISO 11179-5], with exceptions as specified in this document.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type in the XML namespace
ruleText: A schema component must not have a base type definition with a {target namespace} that is the XML namespace.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:ID.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:IDREF.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:IDREFS
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:IDREFS.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:anyType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:anyType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:anySimpleType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:NOTATION
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:NOTATION.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:ENTITY.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.1.1. Types prohibited as base types
ruleTitle: No base type of xs:ENTITIES
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}base with a value of xs:ENTITIES.

ruleTitle: Simple type definition is top-level
ruleText: A simple type definition MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: No simple type disallowed derivation
ruleText: An element xs:simpleType MUST NOT have an attribute {}final.

ruleTitle: Simple type has data definition
ruleText: A simple type MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: No use of fixed on simple type facets
ruleText: A simple type constraining facet MUST NOT have an attribute {}fixed.

ruleTitle: Enumeration has data definition
ruleText: An enumeration facet MUST have a data definition.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:ID.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:IDREF.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:anySimpleType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.1. Simple types prohibited as list item types
ruleTitle: No list item type of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}itemType with a value of xs:ENTITY.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:ID.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:IDREF.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:IDREFS
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:IDREFS.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:anySimpleType.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:ENTITY.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.2.2. Simple types prohibited as union member types
ruleTitle: No union member types of xs:ENTITIES
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}memberTypes that includes a value of xs:ENTITIES.

ruleTitle: Complex type definition is top-level
ruleText: A complex type definition MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: Complex type has data definition
ruleText: A complex type MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: No mixed content on complex type
ruleText: A complex type definition MUST NOT have mixed content.

ruleTitle: No mixed content on complex content
ruleText: A complex type definition with complex content MUST NOT have mixed content.

ruleTitle: Complex type content is explicitly simple or complex
ruleText: An element xs:complexType MUST have a child element xs:simpleContent or xs:complexContent.

ruleTitle: Complex content uses extension
ruleText: An element xs:complexContent MUST have a child xs:extension.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.3.2.1. Base type of complex type with complex content has complex content
ruleTitle: Base type of complex type with complex content must have complex content
ruleText: The base type of complex type that has complex content MUST be a complex type with complex content.

sectionLabel: Section 9.1.3.2.1. Base type of complex type with complex content has complex content
ruleTitle: Base type of complex type with complex content must have complex content
ruleText: The base type of complex type that has complex content MUST have complex content.

ruleTitle: Simple content uses extension
ruleText: A complex type definition with simple content schema component MUST have a derivation method of extension.

ruleTitle: No complex type disallowed substitutions
ruleText: An element xs:complexType MUST NOT have an attribute {}block.

ruleTitle: No complex type disallowed derivation
ruleText: An element xs:complexType MUST NOT have an attribute {}final.

ruleTitle: Element declaration is top-level
ruleText: An element declaration MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: Element declaration has data definition
ruleText: An element declaration MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Untyped element is abstract
ruleText: A top-level element declaration that does not set the {type definition} property via the attribute "type" MUST have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

ruleTitle: Element of type xs:anySimpleType is abstract
ruleText: An element declaration that has a type xs:anySimpleType MUST have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

ruleTitle: Element type not in the XML Schema namespace
ruleText: An element type that is not xs:anySimpleType MUST NOT have a namespace name xs.

ruleTitle: Element type not in the XML namespace
ruleText: An element type MUST NOT have a namespace name that is in the XML namespace.

ruleTitle: Element type is not simple type
ruleText: An element type that is not xs:anySimpleType MUST NOT be a simple type.

ruleTitle: No element disallowed substitutions
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}block.

ruleTitle: No element disallowed derivation
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}final.

ruleTitle: No element default value
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}default.

ruleTitle: No element fixed value
ruleText: An element xs:element MUST NOT have an attribute {}fixed.

ruleTitle: Element declaration is nillable
ruleText: An element declaration MUST have the {nillable} property with a value of true.

ruleTitle: Attribute declaration is top-level
ruleText: An attribute declaration MUST be top-level.

ruleTitle: Attribute declaration has data definition
ruleText: An attribute declaration MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Attribute declaration has type
ruleText: A top-level attribute declaration MUST have a type.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:ID
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:ID.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:IDREF
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:IDREF.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:IDREFS
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:IDREFS.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:ENTITY
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:ENTITY.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:ENTITIES
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:ENTITIES.

ruleTitle: No attribute type of xs:anySimpleType
ruleText: A schema component MUST NOT have an attribute {}type with a value of xs:anySimpleType.

ruleTitle: No attribute default values
ruleText: An element xs:attribute MUST NOT have an attribute {}default.

ruleTitle: No fixed values for optional attributes
ruleText: This rule does not constrain attribute uses that are required   An element xs:attribute that is not a required attribute use MUST NOT have an attribute {}fixed.

ruleTitle: No use of element xs:notation
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:notation.

ruleTitle: Model group does not affect meaning
ruleText: The use of model groups xs:all, xs:sequence, and xs:choice MUST NOT define the semantics of an instance. The meaning of an element occurrence within an element occurrence MUST be identical, regardless of the model group used to define a schema component.

ruleTitle: No xs:all
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:all

ruleTitle: xs:sequence must be child of xs:extension
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST be a child of element xs:extension.

ruleTitle: xs:sequence must be child of xs:extension or xs:restriction
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST be a child of element xs:extension or xs:restriction.

ruleTitle: No xs:choice
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:choice

ruleTitle: xs:choice must be child of xs:sequence
ruleText: An element xs:choice MUST be a child of element xs:sequence.

ruleTitle: Sequence has minimum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST either not have the attribute {}minOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: Sequence has maximum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:sequence MUST either not have the attribute {}maxOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: Choice has minimum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:choice MUST either not have the attribute {}minOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: Choice has maximum cardinality 1
ruleText: An element xs:choice MUST either not have the attribute {}maxOccurs, or that attribute MUST have a value of 1.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:any
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:any.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:anyAttribute
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:anyAttribute.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:unique
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:unique.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:key
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:key.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:keyref
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:keyref.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:group
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:group.

ruleTitle: No definition of attribute groups
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain an attribute group definition schema component.

ruleTitle: Comment is not recommended
ruleText: An XML Comment is not an XML Schema annotation component; an XML comment SHOULD NOT appear in the schema.

ruleTitle: Documentation element has no element children
ruleText: A child of element xs:documentation MUST be text or an XML comment.

ruleTitle: xs:appinfo children are comments, elements, or whitespace
ruleText: A child of element xs:appinfo MUST be an element, a comment, or whitespace text.

ruleTitle: Appinfo child elements have namespaces
ruleText: An element that is a child of xs:appinfo MUST have a namespace name.

ruleTitle: Appinfo descendants are not XML Schema elements
ruleText: An element with a namespace name of xs: MUST NOT have an ancestor element xs:appinfo.

ruleTitle: Schema has data definition
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST have a data definition.

ruleTitle: Schema document defines target namespace
ruleText: The schema MUST define a target namespace.

ruleTitle: Target namespace is absolute URI
ruleText: The value of the attribute targetNamespace MUST match the production <absolute-URI> as defined by RFC 3986.

ruleTitle: Schema has version
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST have an attribute {}version that MUST NOT be empty.

ruleTitle: No disallowed substitutions
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST NOT have an attribute {}blockDefault.

ruleTitle: No disallowed derivations
ruleText: An element xs:schema MUST NOT have an attribute {}finalDefault.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:redefine
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:redefine.

ruleTitle: No use of xs:include
ruleText: The schema MUST NOT contain the element xs:include.

ruleTitle: xs:import must have namespace
ruleText: An element xs:import MUST have an attribute {}namespace.

ruleTitle: XML Schema document set must be complete
ruleText: The schema document set must constitute a complete XML Schema; it must contain the definition of every schema component referenced by any component defined by the schema set.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute type is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @type MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute base is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @base MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute itemType is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @itemType MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespaces referenced by attribute memberTypes is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a type referenced by @memberTypes MUST be the target namespace, the XML Schema namespace, or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute ref is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a component referenced by @ref MUST be the target namespace or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 9.8.1. Namespaces for referenced components are imported
ruleTitle: Namespace referenced by attribute substitutionGroup is imported
ruleText: The namespace of a component referenced by @substitutionGroup MUST be the target namespace or be imported.

sectionLabel: Section 10.1. Categories of NIEM type definitions
ruleTitle: Complex type has a category
ruleText:
Within the schema, a complex type definition MUST be one of the following: 
- An object type. 
- An association type. 
- A metadata type. 
- An augmentation type.

sectionLabel: Section 10.2.1.1. Object types with complex content
ruleTitle: Object type with complex content is derived from structures:ObjectType
ruleText: An object type with complex content MUST be derived from structures:ObjectType or from another object type.

ruleTitle: RoleOf element type is an object type
ruleText: The type definition of a RoleOf element MUST be an object type.

ruleTitle: Only object type has RoleOf element
ruleText: A complex type that includes a RoleOf element in its content model MUST be an object type.

ruleTitle: RoleOf elements indicate the base types of a role type
ruleText: An element declaration that has a local name that begins with the string RoleOf MUST represent a base type, of which the containing element instance represents a role.

ruleTitle: Instance of RoleOf element indicates a role object
ruleText:
When a parent element has a child element valid to an element declaration that is a RoleOf element, 
- The value of the parent element is a role object. 
- The value of the child element is a base object of the role object.

ruleTitle: Import of external namespace has data definition
ruleText: An element xs:import that is annotated as importing an external schema document MUST be a documented component.

ruleTitle: External adapter type has indicator
ruleText: A type is an external adapter type if and only if it is a complex type with application information of attribute appinfo:externalAdapterTypeIndicator with a value of true.

ruleTitle: Structure of external adapter type definition follows pattern
ruleText: An external adapter type definition MUST be a complex type definition with complex content that extends structures:ObjectType, and that uses xs:sequence as its top-level compositor.

ruleTitle: Element use from external adapter type defined by external schema documents
ruleText: An element reference that appears within an external adapter type MUST have a target namespace that is imported as external.

ruleTitle: External adapter type not a base type
ruleText: An external adapter type definition MUST NOT be a base type definition.

ruleTitle: External adapter type not a base type
ruleText: An external adapter type definition MUST NOT be a base type definition.

ruleTitle: External attribute use only in external adapter type
ruleText: An external attribute use MUST be in an external adapter type.

ruleTitle: External attribute use has data definition
ruleText: An external attribute use MUST be a documented component with a non-empty data definition.

ruleTitle: External attribute use not an ID
ruleText: An attribute use schema component MUST NOT have an {attribute declaration} with an ID type.

ruleTitle: External element use has data definition
ruleText: An external attribute use MUST be a documented component with a non-empty data definition.

ruleTitle: Name of code type ends in CodeType
ruleText: A complex type definition with a {base type definition} of a code type or code simple type SHOULD have a {name} that ends in 'CodeType'.

ruleTitle: Code type corresponds to a code list
ruleText: A complex type SHOULD have a name ending in CodeType if and only if it has a correspondence to a list of distinct conceptual entities.

ruleTitle: Element of code type has code representation term
ruleText: An element with a type that is a code type SHOULD have a name with representation term "Code"

ruleTitle: Proxy type has designated structure
ruleText: A proxy type MUST have the designated structure. It MUST use xs:extension. It MUST NOT use xs:attribute. It MUST include exactly one xs:attributeGroup reference, which must be to structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup.

ruleTitle: Association type derived from structures:AssociationType
ruleText: A type MUST have an association type name if and only if it is derived from an association type.

ruleTitle: Association element type is an association type
ruleText: An element MUST have a name that ends in 'Association' if and only if it has a type that is an association type.

ruleTitle: Augmentable type has augmentation point element
ruleText: An augmentable type MUST contain an element use of its corresponding augmentation point element.

ruleTitle: Augmentable type has at most one augmentation point element
ruleText: An augmentable type MUST contain no more than one element use of its corresponding augmentation point element.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point element corresponds to its base type
ruleText: A schema document containing an element declaration for an augmentation point element MUST also contain a type definition for its base type, a corresponding augmentable type.

ruleTitle: An augmentation point element has no type
ruleText: An augmentation point element MUST have no type.

ruleTitle: An augmentation point element has no substitution group
ruleText: An augmentation point element MUST have no substitution group.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point element is only referenced by its base type
ruleText: An augmentation point element MUST only be referenced by its base type.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point element use is optional
ruleText: An augmentation point element particle MUST have attribute minOccurs equal to 0.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point element use is unbounded
ruleText: An augmentation point element particle MUST have attribute maxOccurs set to unbounded.

ruleTitle: Augmentation point element use must be last element in its base type
ruleText: An augmentation point element particle MUST be the last element occurrence in its content model.

ruleTitle: Element within instance of augmentation type modifies base
ruleText:
Given:Element $relationship establishes a relationship between $base-value and the value of $relationship. 
- Some element has a value $base-value. 
- Value $base-value contains element $augmentation. 
- Element $augmentation has property [element declaration] with a value that is an augmentation element declaration. 
- Element $augmentation has a value, by reference or by content. 
- The value of $augmentation contains element $relationship. 
- Element $relationship has a value, by reference or by content.

ruleTitle: Only an augmentation type name ends in AugmentationType
ruleText: A schema component that has a name that ends in AugmentationType MUST be an augmentation type.

ruleTitle: Schema component with name ending in AugmentationType is an augmentation type
ruleText: An augmentation type definition schema component with {name} ending in 'AugmentationType' MUST be an augmentation type definition that is a complex type definition with complex content that extends or restricts an augmentation type.

ruleTitle: Type derived from structures:AugmentationType is an augmentation type
ruleText: A type definition derived from an augmentation type MUST be an augmentation type definition

ruleTitle: Augmentation element type is an augmentation type
ruleText: An element declaration MUST have a name that ends in "Augmentation" if and only if it has a type that is an augmentation type.

ruleTitle: Augmentation elements are not used directly
ruleText:
Within a reference schema document, a complex type definition MUST NOT have an element use of 
- an augmentation element declaration, or 
- an element declaration that is in the substitution group of an augmentation point element declaration.

ruleTitle: Metadata type has data about data
ruleText: Within the schema, a metadata type MUST contain elements appropriate for a specific class of data about data.

ruleTitle: Metadata types are derived from structures:MetadataType
ruleText: A type MUST be a metadata type if and only if it is derived from a metadata type.

ruleTitle: Metadata element declaration type is a metadata type
ruleText: An element MUST have a name that ends in 'Metadata' if and only if it has a type that is a metadata type.

ruleTitle: Metadata element has applicable elements
ruleText:
The set of applicable elements for a metadata element declaration are as follows: 
- A metadata element declaration that has neither an attribute appinfo:appliesToTypes nor an attribute appinfo:appliesToElements may be applied to any element. 
- A metadata element declaration that has either an attribute appinfo:appliesToTypes or an attribute appinfo:appliesToElements may be applied to any element whose qualified name is in the value of appinfo:appliesToElements, or any element with a declaration that is in the substitution group of the declaration of such an element, and to any element with a type with a qualified name that is in the value of appinfo:appliesToTypes, or any element with a type that is validly derived from such a type. 
- any element whose qualified name is in the value of appinfo:appliesToElements, or any element with a declaration that is in the substitution group of the declaration of such an element, and to 
- any element with a type with a qualified name that is in the value of appinfo:appliesToTypes, or any element with a type that is validly derived from such a type.

ruleTitle: Name of element that ends in Representation is abstract
ruleText: An element declaration with a name that ends in 'Representation' SHOULD have the {abstract} property with a value of "true".

sectionLabel: Section 10. Rules for NIEM modeling, by NIEM concept
ruleTitle: A substitution for a representation element declaration is a value for a type
ruleText: Any element declaration that is substitutable for a representation element declaration represents an optional representation of a value of a type that carries the representation element.

ruleTitle: Schema component name composed of English words
ruleText: The name of any XML Schema component defined by the schema SHOULD be composed of words from the English language, using the prevalent U.S. spelling, as provided by [OED].

ruleTitle: Schema component names have only specific characters
ruleText: The name of an XML Schema component defined by the schema must be composed of only the characters uppercase 'A' through 'Z', lowercase 'a' through 'z', numbers '0' through '9', underscore, hyphen, and period.

ruleTitle: Punctuation in component name is a separator
ruleText: The characters hyphen (-), underscore (_) MAY appear in a component name only when used as a separator between parts of a word, phrase, or value, which would otherwise be incomprehensible without the use of a separator. The period character (.) MAY appear in component names only when appearing as a separator (as above) or as a decimal within a numeric value. A punctuation character MUST NOT be used as a substitute for camel case in component names, or as a method to avoid camel case in component names.

ruleTitle: Names use camel case
ruleText: The name of any XML Schema component defined by the schema MUST use the camel case formatting convention.

ruleTitle: Attribute name begins with lower case letter
ruleText: Within the schema, any attribute declaration MUST have a name that begins with a lowercase letter ('a'-'z').

ruleTitle: Name of schema component other than attribute and proxy type begins with upper case letter
